docs.title: py-tes
docs.text: py-tes is a library for interacting with servers implementing the GA4GH Task Execution Schema.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
import tes

# define task
task = tes.Task(
    executors=[
        tes.Executor(
            image="alpine",
            command=["echo", "hello"]
        )
    ]
)

# create client
cli = tes.HTTPClient("https://funnel.example.com", timeout=5)

# access endpoints
service_info = cli.get_service_info()
task_id = cli.create_task(task)
task_info = cli.get_task(task_id, view="BASIC")
cli.cancel_task(task_id)
tasks_list = cli.list_tasks(view="MINIMAL")  # default view

docs.title: ...export a model to a dictionary
docs.text:
task_dict = task.as_dict(drop_empty=False)

task_dict contents:

{'id': None, 'state': None, 'name': None, 'description': None, 'inputs': None, 'outputs': None, 'resources': None, 'executors': [{'image': 'alpine', 'command': ['echo', 'hello'], 'workdir': None, 'stdin': None, 'stdout': None, 'stderr': None, 'env': None}], 'volumes': None, 'tags': None, 'logs': None, 'creation_time': None}

docs.title: ...access a specific task from the task list
docs.text:
specific_task = tasks_list.tasks[5]

specific_task contents:

Task(id='393K43', state='COMPLETE', name=None, description=None, inputs=None, outputs=None, resources=None, executors=None, volumes=None, tags=None, logs=None, creation_time=None)

docs.title: ...instantiate a model from a JSON representation
docs.text:
task_from_json = tes.client.unmarshal(task_json, tes.Task)

task_from_json contents:

Task(id=None, state=None, name=None, description=None, inputs=None, outputs=None, resources=None, executors=[Executor(image='alpine', command=['echo', 'hello'], workdir=None, stdin=None, stdout=None, stderr=None, env=None)], volumes=None, tags=None, logs=None, creation_time=None)

Which is equivalent to task:

print(task_from_json == task)

Output:

True

docs.title: function append_suffixes_to_url
docs.text:
append_suffixes_to_url(urls: List[str], suffixes: List[str]) → List[str]

Compile all combinations of full paths from paths and suffixes.

Args:

  • urls: List of URL paths.
  • prefixes: List of suffixes to be appended to urls.

Returns: List of full path combinations, in the provided order of paths and suffixes, starting with all suffix combinations for the first path, then those for the second path, and so on. Paths are stripped of any trailing slashes.

Examples: client = tes.HTTPClient.append_suffixes_to_url(['https://funnel.exa mple.com'], ['ga4gh/tes/v1', 'v1', '']) ['https://funnel.example.com/ga4gh/tes/v1', 'https://funnel.example.com /v1', 'https://funnel.example.com']

docs.title: function send_request
docs.text:
send_request(
    paths: List[str],
    method: str = 'get',
    kwargs_requests: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None,
    **kwargs: Any
) → Response

Send request to a list of URLs, returning the first valid response.

Args:

  • paths: List of fully qualified URLs.
  • method: HTTP method to use for the request; one of 'get' (default), 'post', 'put', and 'delete'.
  • kwargs_requests: Keyword arguments to pass to the :mod:requests call.
  • **kwargs: Keyword arguments for path parameter substition.

Returns: The first successful response from the list of endpoints.

Raises:

  • requests.exceptions.HTTPError: If no response is received from any path.
  • requests.exceptions.HTTPError: As soon as the first 4xx or 5xx status code is received.
  • requests.exceptions.HTTPError: If, after trying all paths, at least one 404 status code and no other 4xx or 5xx status codes are received.
  • ValueError: If an unsupported HTTP method is provided.

docs.title: Modules
docs.text:
• client: TES access methods and helper functions.
  • models: TES models, converters, validators and helpers.
  • utils: Exceptions and utilities.

docs.title: Classes
docs.text:
• client.HTTPClient: HTTP client class for interacting with the TES API.
  • models.Base: attrs base class for all TES and helper models.
  • models.CancelTaskRequest: attrs model class for POST /tasks/{id}:cancel request parameters.
  • models.CancelTaskResponse: TES tesCancelTaskResponse attrs model class.
  • models.CreateTaskResponse: TES tesCreateTaskResponse attrs model class.
  • models.Executor: TES tesExecutor attrs model class.
  • models.ExecutorLog: TES tesExecutorLog attrs model class.
  • models.GetTaskRequest: attrs model class for GET /tasks/{id} request parameters.
  • models.Input: TES tesInput attrs model class.
  • models.ListTasksRequest: attrs model class for GET /tasks request parameters.
  • models.ListTasksResponse: TES tesListTasksResponse attrs model class.
  • models.Output: TES tesOutput attrs model class.
  • models.OutputFileLog: TES tesOutputFileLog attrs model class.
  • models.Resources: TES tesResources attrs model class.
  • models.ServiceInfo: TES tesServiceInfo attrs model class.
  • models.ServiceInfoRequest: attrs model class for GET /service-info request parameters.
  • models.Task: TES tesTask attrs model class.
  • models.TaskLog: TES tesTaskLog attrs model class.
  • utils.TimeoutError
  • utils.UnmarshalError: Raised when a JSON string cannot be unmarshalled to a TES model.

docs.title: method get_task
docs.text:
get_task(task_id: str, view: str = 'BASIC') → Task

Access method for GET /tasks/{id}.

Args:

  • task_id: TES Task ID.
  • view: Task info verbosity. One of MINIMAL, BASIC and FULL.

Returns: tes.models.Task instance.

docs.title: function strconv
docs.text:
strconv(value: Any) → Any

Explicitly cast a string-like value or list thereof to string(s).

Args:

  • value: Value to convert.

Returns: Converted value. If value is a list, all elements are converted to strings. If value is not string-like, it will be returned as is.

docs.title: function unmarshal
docs.text:
unmarshal(j: Any, o: Type, convert_camel_case=True) → Any

Unmarshal a JSON string to a TES model.

Args:

  • j: JSON string or dictionary to unmarshal.
  • o: TES model to unmarshal to.
  • convert_camel_case: Convert values in j from camelCase to snake_case.

Returns: Unmarshalled TES model.

Raises:

  • UnmarshalError: If j cannot be unmarshalled to o.
